q: the collapse of such a dictatorship was "inevitable" in Egypt, as well as in other countries throughout the world. "What comes next, it's hard to predict," Patrick Leahy said. A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now. "The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued, "because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere." Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.

NFL.com- For the second time, Eagles quarterback Kevin Kolb has expressed a desire to start. My big deal is I just want to start somewhere, said Kevin Kolb , who lost his job to Michael Vick after being injured in the season opener. Auditions for US contestants begin on 27 March in Los Angeles. Other sessions follow in Chicago, Dallas, Miami, Seattle and New York. Talking at a news conference Simon Cowell said: The top contestant will get$ 1 million( Â£ 619,000) a year for five years, separate from the costs involved in recording and promotion. "It's a massive, massive risk but it's also an incredible incentive. It puts everybody, rightly, under an enormous amount of pressure. "I believe I can find a star. But he admitted: "If they don't sell a single record they still get to keep the money. It is pressure, because if the wrong person wins, I'm in trouble.

As executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. We've got very complicated government issues, he said, adding that "we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale."
